name: Artificial Intelligence lab
references: Stuart Russell, Peter Norvig, “Artificial Intelligence -A Modern Approach”, 3/e, Pearson, 2003.
Trevor Hastie, Robert Tibshirani, Jerome Friedman, “The Elements of Statistical Learning: Data Mining, Inference, And Prediction”, 2nd Edition, Springer, 2017.
Christopher M. Bishop, “Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning”, Springer, 2010.
Introduction to Statistical Learning in Python: [https://github.com/emredjan/ISLpython](https://github.com/emredjan/ISLpython)
experiments: Implement uninformed search techniques such as DFS, BFS, and IDS.
Implement informed search technique A* with suitable heuristic functions.
Implement local search techniques such as Hill Climbing, GA, and SA.
Implement multiplayer games using minimax, ∝-β pruning, and expecti minimax. (e.g: tic tac toe, Nim, a problem involving dice).
Solve Constraint Satisfaction Problems (e.g: Map coloring).
Implement kNN for classification and Regression.
Implement SVM for classification and Regression.
Implement ANN for classification and Regression.
Implement clustering using the EM algorithm.
Use the EM algorithm for learning with hidden variables.
